review: Salutations santa's little yelpers!! I just ate here on my lunch break, it was virtually empty yet took 40 minutes for my chicken sandwich, which leads me to believe the chef kept tripping on the abundance of pygmy warriors they use to hunt the chickens, they hate their job, or they just trying to keep the white man down... the sandwich was the bomb though, or if I was in an airplane, "it was really good"... Thanks Annie  I'll give ya a half salute because the pygmy warriors may actually exist in the kitchen

I hope whoever you take here is patient and interesting because this CPK is super slow! This CPK location has the same good ol' CPK menu. It is small and often busy but it's always slow. It always takes a long time to get seated, get the menu, order, get your food, get the check, and get a box to go.  And c'mon it's Westwood Village, not the mall or the airport. Why not try something new and help the local businesses? It'll sure save you some time and money. ZzzZZzzzZZzzZzZ

At 3:30pm this place had 6 tables taken and 2 waiters. And it took 5 minutes to seat us. They tell us to sit anywhere and we do but we didnt get menus. Another 5 minutes go by as we watch the waiter/waitress charge the bills for the tables that are ready to pay. We get the menus and are ready to order but our waitress is running around making drinks and charging more tables. Looking around you can see that the other tables are waiting for one thing or another. Service is real slow here. The food was good though!

I love the spinach artichoke dip here -- $10. The jambalaya was aitee ($15.50). The chicken alfredo here is pretty good though.  Service is okay. The prices were meh, could be a dollar lower and I'd be okay with it. One plus though were the free refills. Between the two of us, we ordered one mango italian soda ($3). Our server was cool about letting us try other flavors (peach, kiwi). We were only charged for one drink on our bill, *thumbs up.*

I love California Pizza Kitchen - always have - but I do not love this location. Every time I come here, the service is terrible. In my opinion, this location is smaller than others; however, they are twice as slow! Why?! What's the hold up?! First time, the hostess entirely forgot about my party (thanks!) and told us we'd have to wait another 40 minutes because she forgot. Other times, it's just plain SLOW SERVICE. I don't mind a wait, but it's the part when you're seated.. and you wait.. and wait.. and wait.  I worked in food service for a short while; I know it's not glamorous but c'mon - there's paying customers present. Tip: If you're super duper hungry, you can ask for bread and butter once you're seated. Go for it - it might be a long wait.

My daughter, who is a teen, treated me to a post Mothers Day lunch at this CPK.  The manager on duty just happened to take our order.  Once she found out that my daughter was treating, she made our lunch VERY enjoyable and affordable.  I have eaten at this location before and have had a good experience and great service.  Thank you CPK Westwood!

I understand it gets busy during lunch, solution? Hire more people!!  First of all, a lot of the people who come here during lunch are UCLA employees (me included) we only get an hour lunch, so it's pretty important that we get in and out quickly.  It's almost impossible to get out of there fast enough. When we go, we always have to make sure we get there at 11:30 to avoid the wave of nooners that come in.  The food? Ehh, alright. It's really nothing spectacular, but I must commend them on freshness and the overall cleanliness of the restaurant and restrooms. The staff is usually very friendly also.

The food was pretty good, its just that service was excruciatingly slow. We were sitted really quickly probably due to some mistake - there was a wait list but the hostess sat us down anyway after looking around the restaurant. Star for that. We sat around waiting... waiting... the waiter finally came and we just ordered everything at once because they were taking a long time to get to us. I ordered bbq chicken pizza, the works, fresh green salad and the tri colour salad pizza. I liked the works - tasted like pizzas I ate in Korea before. Tri colour salad pizza is basically a salad on top of thin pizza crackers - it was REALLY chewy, oddly so. Maybe they over cooked it?? The salad never came - we didn't really ask about it because the salad pizza was pretty much like a salad by itself. I asked for the check after we were done and the check included the salad so we told them we never received it. They told us that it was JUST done being prepared - what? how can a salad take longer than 3 pizzas to be prepared?? We said we just wanted it off of our tab because we were done with our meal. They just gave us the salad anyway (star for that) we had to wait a long time for the fixed check, to go box, etc. We wanted to empty the table for them since it was a full house but man they are REALLY slow...

My friend and I decided to see Magic Mike tonight so we stopped in to eat at CPK. We were seated very fast in a booth seat. And our waiter was nice but very awkward. This wasn't the problem though.... I went to get up and go to the bathroom and asked one of the ladies working there where the bathroom was. Very quietly without even a whisper replies "the right over there" without any direction to where "there" was. So I asked again to clarify that it was back against the back wall of the restaurant and in a very distraught way she says, "yes ma'am".  1. Dont call me "ma'am". I'm 18 yrs old. 2. Speak up so I can hear you 3. Dont give me attitude I'm a paying customer Im only asking where the bathroom is.... So I sit down with my friend and tell her about what happened and we were just kind of like wow wtf... So then the lady walks by and I flag her down because I needed some more water I was very thirsty. So I ask and say, "Excuse me ma'am can I have some more water?"  Well the look she gave me was absolutely rude and disgusting. Not only that my water never came she purposely walked by with the water pitcher and it was full and never attempted to look at me or poor water into my glass. Its like after I called her ma'am she suddenly too became offended  but actually made sure I saw that, but the difference was she was like 30 something and I'm 18 you call me "miss" and I call you "ma'am". So we waited and waited and it became like a joke cause she never came with the water so I asked some waiter guy for water and it was there right away.  They werent busy. She wasn't busy. This was absolutely uncalled for and someone needs to talk to that hostess lady.... Seriously. Until then your not going to get my business or my friends business at your store.

Food is nice, Service is kinda on the slow side, decor is great. You got Tv's and pizza. What more can you ask for?I ordered a Caesar Salad and spaghetti marinara. Caesar salad was same as usually, which I do like. Creamy sauce and the beautiful salad... just staring at it for 10 minutes was torture... then I couldn't stand it and stuffed  it in 5 minutes. Next came the pasta. When I tried it, it was a new taste (I liked it!!). Servie was kinda slow but the wait was manageable. Deserves a 4/5.

I can't say much about the service, but CPK is an okay place for a bite to eat. It reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory, except CPK isn't as nice and the service is a total downgrade.  Regardless, I can't help but devour their baby clam linguini (white sauce is tons yummier than red sauce) and their signature bbq chicken salad. I actually dislike the whole bbq chicken aspect of it -- everything except it is awesome. That dressing can't be good for you but damn. That salad is amazing. Their foccacio bread thing is delicious as well.

I find myself at this location often and the food and service is always great. The cuisine here is more innovative than authentic, but they do the classics very well so i really don't see a problem in either regard. More often than not, the door is opened for me upon approach and a pleasant dining experience always ensues.  I've been a fan of CPK for many years and have thoroughly bounced around the menu, which has much for everyone. I personally am a HUGE fan of the "Sicilian" pizza which I pair with an ice cold Guinness. When in mood for pasta, I order the "Fettuccine with Garlic Cream Sauce" with chicken and sauteed mushrooms (you can also order this with shrimp). For $1 you can order a side of  delicious, hot, watch-the-butter-as-it-melts, pita bread (which is what I do alternatively to having the house bread brought out).  I'm here on a weekly basis and am genuinely surprised at some of these reviews. Even the rare, more inexperienced waiters here stay busy, make small talk and smile. What more can you ask for when casually dining? I also don't  understand how you could slam an Italian-style restaurant with a 1 star rant-of-a-review because of the "Chinese Chicken Salad," which isn't even half bad. And yes, it's busy during peak lunch hour and if you get there late enough you're obviously going to have to wait.

Our food was very good. I had the roasted vegetable salad, which was loaded with veggies. My sister had the candied peach salad, which she liked. The peaches were a little soggy for we taste. My mother had the tortilla soup , which was delicious.  The bad- we shared the chips and guacamole as an appetizer. Our waitress, Terri asked us if we wanted bread and we said yes. She walked away, just as we were about to cancel the appetizer order. We figured we'd tell her when she came with our drinks. She returned and we asked if we could cancel it, but she said it was too late. Really? Then she said, well I asked if you wanted bread and you said yes. We told her how we tried to flag her down before but she had walked away so quickly. Since she did not offer a solution, we left it at that. The rest of our visit was tense and awkward. She was standoffish. This is the first time that I haven't had a positive experience here. Usually, everyone is so nice and goes above and beyond. I was very disappointed. A simple apology would have been just fine. As a former waitress, I know that you have to take responsibility for things, even when it's not your fault.

I came here with a group of coworkers for lunch and had a really great experience. We had group of 8 people so the wait took a bit of time before we were seated outside. The waiter was very friendly and service was quick. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi Zucchini Fettuccine as one of their new adventures items. In my opinion, it had a tad too much zucchini and too little fettuccine. The cook was very generous with the shrimps though and I was very happy since I'm a big fan of them. The sauce was creamy and I like it a lot.  My coworkers ordered various pizza as well as the Chinese Salad and they all seemed to like them a lot. The good thing about CPK is that its menu basically has food from all over the world so you can get a little bit of everything if you share.

This place just doesn't fail to disappoint.  The salad was pretty pitiful (I ordered the California Cobb). CPK calls the nasty white centers of lettuce hearts a salad? With dressing so minimal... I could not have told the difference between what I got and a "100-calorie only!" sized rip-off for lunch.  And the strawberry lemonade - CPK, your competitor down the street at least gives it a full-hearted attempt by adding (or better yet! making it with) REAL strawberry or something that at least is authentic enough to contain strawberry seeds. At CPK, you'll pay for what seems to be high fructose-ey Minute Maid lemonade mixed with some other yucky excuse for the strawberry component. Again, a disappointment.  On the plus side, the service this time was much better. I can for sure confirm that I will not be returning to this CPK again, much less any other. The food here is simply disappointing.

I got a take out order 1 new pulled pork pizza( habanero carnitas pizza), one BBQ chicken pizza and 1 Bbq chicken salad. The meat on the pulled pork pizza was so overcooked and dry. Leather-like, unedible. The BBQ chicken pizza tasted like a frozen grocery store pizza, undercooked and plastic tasting.  This is so disappointing. At $16 for the salad, it was ok, but $16!!!??  Pizzas were $13 each. This will keep me from going back to any CPK. Shame they've become so commercialized.  Frozen manufactured, prefixed meals....sad....

Probably the best California Pizza Kitchen I've been to. I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich for lunch and it was really good!  We sat outside and it was really nice, didn't see the inside but for lunch outside on a nice LA day it was prime!  The staff was really friendly and our waitress was great! Definitely will return.

First off, I should start off by saying that I am not a fan of big chain restaurants such as CPK, but my co-workers insisted on coming here the other day. Wow! This place is pricey for the quality of food. Everything I have ever ordered here at various locations over the years has been less than memorable. What keeps me coming back? Well let me tell you, it is never by choice, but because of the company I am with. I don't know why anyone would continue coming here when 800 degrees is down the street with much better ingredients, better pizza, and for a lower price.
solid cpk. Not a great location in terms of parking and service. Usually crowded and apathetic servers. Saving grace...the pizza of course.

First CPK experience.....was amazing. Server was very nice and attentive. He alone earned this place the 5 stars. We had "the works" pizza it was also amazing and washed it down with a couple of blue moons. Couldnt ask for more.

Standard CPK meal. Actually decent pizzas, I actually like the think crust artichoke one a lot. Average service. It's a nice and big space with outdoor seating for the warmer days. Nothing extra to rave about and nothing to complain about.

This review is solely based on the food since I got take out.   What I ordered:  Crispy Mac n' Cheese:  Fried and covered with cheese, it can't be that bad right? WRONG. Even my bf cringed upon eating these and he has pretty much no standards when it comes to fried foods. For the price you pay, you'd at the very least expect house made mac n' cheese. These might as well have come from a box, cause that's what it tasted like.  Avocado Club Spring Rolls- For something called an AVOCADO spring roll, there was maybe a couple slivers of avocado, at best. Not worth the price. Skin was soggy not crispy. If you're having a hankering for fried avocado rolls, go to BJ's Brewery. They have avocado spring rolls stuffed with avocado for half the price. The rolls here are absolute jokes. Cedar Plank Salmon- Not terrible. Overcooked maybe but tolerable. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine: Pasta and chicken were DRY.  VERDICT? Blech. Most disgusting highly priced food I've had in a long time.
Review based on their new menu item: Quinua and Arugula Salad! VERY delicious! and healthy! Good change to CPK!

Came in before while I was still going to UCLA and had a nice experience. After coming back for an anniversary dinner with my boyfriend to celebrate where we had our first date we had a horrible experience. I feel like CPK is going down hill.  We came in during dinner service, which we were sited in the very back. Hostess smiled and sat us down but felt like we were hauled like cattle. The waiter greeted us and asked if were ready - typical start of to any dine in restaurant. My boyfriend asked for any suggestions, the waiter responded by pointing at the menu and said "here" throwing the menu back at him.  We could tell he wanted to take our order and leave. Did not feel welcomed at all.  Food was ok, sad that the miso salad I normally ordered was no longer on the menu. The cobb salad my boyfriend ordered was not appealing at all. It was not tossed and it looked like it was just thrown on the plate - gross. I mean, salad is the easiest to prepare. It doesn't take that long to make it look good. The waiter never came back only til after we finished everything and 15 min and more waiting for him. We were completely ignored the entire time.  Normally I tip well because I also work in the food industry, so I know how hard it is to deal with customers and handling/juggling everything. But this is the first time I had to not tip! I will no longer be coming to this CPK. Sad.  Note: We also overheard that the waiter couldn't wait to quit since he already had a job interview and was waiting for a call back. Most likely affected his service to us since it showed he no longer cared. Hopefully he gets his act together if he still is with CPK. If not I wish him the best of luck on his new ventures.

CPK! You are improving. And I had a lovely experience here today. Food was great--super fresh, flavorful, and a large variety. I think their new menu options really bring in many new choices of flavors and combinations..a great way to try new recipes without having to try new places (and risk sacrificing quality of ingrediants). Everything was yummy, well-cooked, and I had a lovely dining experience. The waiters were SO friendly and welcoming, keeping our party good-to-go on refills and checking in on us to make sure that our dining experience was great! My party ordered: -carmelized peach salad w/ salmon (yummy! salmon was very good) -their new mother's day special fresh salad -mushroom pizza

Remind me never to eat at a chain restaurant in a college town again.  1. Not CPK's fault, but I don't think I like being served by college students who part time at a restaurant. I guess I'm just used to being served by professionals. 2. I couldn't determine which one it was, or maybe it was both, but either the tables or the menus smelled like old wet rag. 3. Food took for ever to come out. Table finished all our drinks before anyone came back to check on us and only did because we asked what's up with the food. 20 minutes passed after order was taken and drinks were served. Nothing on our table but empty glasses.

Maybe it was cause I had low expectations due to the reviews I read before coming here the other day, but CPK really exceeded my expectations. Our waiter definitely made the experience 100x more enjoyable, constantly refilling our drinks and checking up on us. The food was a little on the slow side, and its not the best deal considering the high price, but it was still yummy I thought. Due to my experience here, I recommend CPK over BJ's down the street, and I want to come back to try the other menu items. Plus, they're giving out thank you coupons, so next time you come, you get some sort of deal.
I love CPK.  Especially for lunch.  I normally have the BBQ chicken salad.  This time I had a sandwich.  It was just ok nothing special.  The soups are also great!

This place confuses me. I realize KPC markets itself is more of a sit-down, upscale pizza place, but I personally think the pizza quality is worse than Pizza Hut or Papa John's. (Granted, I'm biased to Pizza Hut having worked six years of my life there.)  The few times that I've been to KPC, I've gotten a medium, one topping pizza for about $15... and it's the size of a small. Like most Americans, I like my portions big and my prices cheap.  The one thing going for the Westwood branch is location. It's right in the heart of the village, so if you're looking for a nice, familiar sit-down restaurant smack dab in the middle of everything, this is pretty safe bet.  But in the words of my good friend Tricia who was visiting LA for a weekend, "We're not going to California Pizza Kitchen... I mean maybe if we were in the Kirkwood County mall food court, but not in LA."
Ok, it's CPK. But I have to write a review because I just tried their BBQ Hawaiian Pizza and Butter cake w/ice cream and OMG! Both soooo good. You gotta try it!!

I think CPK is a great restaurant chain.  The staff is always friendly and accommodating.   UPDATE:  I am so jazzed that CPK now offers lunch specials where you can choose a smaller version of pizza with a secondary choice of salad, soup, appetizer or other offerings. I absolutely love their non-alcoholic sparkling cranberry cooler, which is only about 50 calories!   The restaurant's newest feature is that if you eat at the counter:  You be able to watch the various chef's create a hand crafted pizza.
Quick effiicient service at the bar, the bartender (Jason?) took great care of me and made me feel welcome. The pizza is the perfect size for one person and was well prepared and piping hot.

We went there with a large party and they sat us right away, service was very good. I wish they would put up calorie counts at this chain though, I've been to ones at other cities and let's just say I had to change my order, it was pretty shocking what some of them were.  But I guess I am giving it 4 stars because I was in somewhat in denial of how many calories I was eating that night.

Roaches. Went with a friend, restaurant was busy, were led to a booth in the back.  After water and a few minutes' conversation, I thought I saw something small dart across my friend's seat.  I got up/tried to grab it, but missed.  She got up, and we flipped the seat up.  Hundreds of roaches.  Literally hundreds.  All sizes.  They brought a vacuum cleaner over and moved us, assuring us that the problem would be taken care of.  I'm still not certain why we stayed for food, but we were not given a discount of any kind.   Insect infestation and one of the worst service responses I've ever experienced.  I don't have much else to say.   This happened a few years ago; have avoided this CPK location like the plague ever since.  Pun intended.

This is the smallest CPK I have ever been to. I came this particular night to help support a fundraiser event for a great cause. But never mind about that, let's talk about the food.  On this particular night they had a 3 course dinner with one appetizer, two entrées, and a dessert. My partner and I decided on the spinach artichoke dip, garlic fettuccine alfredo, the original bbq chicken pizza (on there new had tossed dough, and finishing it off with a butter cake.  The dp was really good, but I wish they would use better chips, which to me, were a bit stale. The pasta was good, but they alfredo was just a tad too clumpy for my taste. The flavors on the pizza was good, but I really couldn't find any difference between the old dough and the new "hand toss" dough. Finally the dessert.  Originally I was going to get the key lime pie. I'm a suckered for a good key lime, but our server suggested that we get the butter cake instead. At this point the hostess chimed in and said it was the best thing the served. Our interest was peaked, so we ordered it. This was the saving grace of the evening. Before the dessert came out I'd ordered a glass of resling and it just wasn't right the would night. It tasted like a dry chardonnay, which I don't like. The resling I ordered was a favorite of mine, but it didn't taste right, even when they opened a new bottle for me. So the fact that the butter cake was so awesome, I forgive the bad wine.  Overall, service was great, food was good, wine was bad,  and the & dessert is worth coming back for.

They say that the best things in life are free....or those things are BBQ Chicken Pizzas with bacon and avocado added for a little more.  I have always ordered the traditional pie when I come here, but in this particular case they said that they could add avocado and bacon to this creation. So I did....It was good... Next time you have a hankering for CPK's Barbecue chicken pizza, splurge, and allow yourself to be overwhelmed by the new textures avocado and bacon give to a classic pie.  Just do it.

This CPK has a great location. Although I've never dined in, my husband and I have ordered take out here. It was super easy to put the order online and all i had to do was pick it up from the store. It's nice because you don't have to park and you can just wait outside and they deliver curbside however, you are blocking traffic and being a major nuisance to others.  The food is good although when u realize you've spend $50 on  a pizza and salad you get a little sticker shock.
as always I hate CPK on principle. my pasta was ok, nothing special.

I came to dinner at CPK with a friend before going to dinner at Pauley Pavilion.  As is the case with all of the eateries in the Village, you are relegated to street parking or the $$$ lots.  Because I was going to the game, I parked on campus. For CPK, this is a relatively small location.  However, it is very popular!  It looks like every other CPK - black and natural colors decor with laquered wood tables and pull up chairs.  There are A  LOT of people working here, and they are very friendly. This time, I ordered the Arugula and Asparagus Salad, which is leaves of arugula with chopped asaparagus tossed with sundried tomatoes and topped with shaved Parmesan.  I substituted the Dijon Balsamic for the lemon vinaigrette, because I prefer the former.  The salad was delicious - lighltly dressed and tossed, as requested, with uber fresh veggies, creamy cheese, and some Marcona almonds for crunch.  Nice touch!  I also ordered the spicy sausage and poblano flatbread, which is a perfect alternative for pizza lovers who can eat their gigantic pies on their own.  An oval crispy flatbread is topped with spicy marinara, some cheese, spicy sausage, and tons of poblano rings.  The pizza was really flavorful, super crisp and not at all greasy. This CPK is doing what CPK does well.  It is unusual for me to say that a corporate chain restaurant really delivers, but CPK consistently does.  I would definitely come back if I am in the area.

Thank you management. I am giving a five star rating even though my food was delivered burnt. Here's why: the manager was apologetic, sympathetic and completely refunded me. The customer service was A+++. Thank you.

Pizza is good here at this location. Price is nice if you go with friends. Not a good beer selection but not a big deal too my. If you like loud busy place then it has lots of people. I am fan of the spaghetti dish and salad is fresh.

I got to the door at 9:29pm The door was already locked. I called and was told that the kitchen closes at 9pm. Spoke to the manager who made it clear that if I want to take home food from CPK in Westwood then I need to get there 5min before his watch shows 9:30pm. He then said that nobody told me that the kitchen closes at 900pm as the kitchen closes when he locks the door. He then said he understands that I am a little upset. I guess I will take my business elsewhere. Their salads are overpriced anyway.

Came here with my club group Thursday night.  The place was PACKED, not only because, well, it was Thursday (a day typically bustling with college night life), but also there happened to be a movie premiere for some new Johnny Depp movie. As expected then, the area was crowded, the streets were blocked, and parking was a nightmare. But I digress. CPK was filled with people, but we had reserved a table for seven. No wait, and the drinks and orders were accomplished relatively quickly. We ordered 4 pizzas (Hawaiian,  Mushroom-Pepperoni, Thai, and BBQ Chicken, I think), two salads (mixed greens with cranberries, walnuts,  and feta cheese and a Chinese chicken-like one. I don't exactly remember), and for me carnitas tacos. The tacos were surprisingly good. The pork had been fried, so it was at once crispy and tender. Had no regrets for adding avocados for an extra 99 cents. As for the rest of the food, I only had the cranberry walnut salad, but I enjoyed the taste of the balsamic vinaigrette and feta cheese, although CPK could have cut down on the amount of dressing. Had a slice of all 4 pizzas; my favorite would have to be the BBQ chicken. I found the Mushroom-Pepperoni too greasy and salty. Maybe it's because I'm not a huge fan of thin-crustedp pizza, but regardless, the pizzas were decent. Despite the crowded night, I had a pleasant, food-filled experience. Definitely come with friends!

Came here expecting a nice lunch with my family. Instead they had horrible service. It took them 15 minutes to sit us down at a dirty table, even though most of the tables were in fact empty. The carpets were filthy and full of trash as if they hadn't cleaned or vacuumed in days. After sitting there for another 15 minutes, there was no waiter to be found. We ended up walking out. Not to mention the woman sitting in a booth nearby had a dog.

We came here with a huge party of 20 after our concert event. Man this CPK is TINY compared to your other usual locations! Luckily they have free 2 hour parking in the parking structure adjacent on broxton! But definitely make RSVP's here if you're group is big otherwise prepare to wait for seating! Our wait time was literally 2 minutes since we made RSVP's :) The waiters are super friendly and energetic and gave us top notch service throughout the night! Yes even though the food did take quite some time to come out and not to mention alotta people were waiting for there drink orders too. But they this place was packed on a Sunday night so we'll give them some slack here. The food is pretty consistent and standard with all other CPK's. You know you have your usual pizzas, pastas, and sandwiches.  The location is also pretty fun to hangout after dinner too. Checkout Stan's donuts next door for some dessert after or take a walk around the first Fox theater nice!
Good consistent food.  Great for lunch.  If you're rolling solo, you can sit at the bar and get awsome service.
the food is ok but their service is just tooooooooooo slow specially if you are going for your lunch break!

came here for my first time and absolutely loved it. service was superb and pizza was very good. came in during lunch time so was a little busy but efficient. tried the fish tacos and pizza Bianca as well as a peach tea!  try to come during non lunch hours if possible. parking is very convenient to my dentist at glamorous smiles so I'll definitely swing by when I can visit again

Couple years later and my view of CPK is still the same. Ordered a half salad to go and although service was fine, I really can't get over paying over $12+ on such a dinky salad. Save yourself and your wallet some money and held over to trader joes and get a prepackaged salad instead. Same quality, same amount, a whole lot cheaper. Even with the promotional savings, CPK is still ridiculously overpriced for what you get (IMO). If you're feeling fancy, head over to chipotle and grab your lunch salad there. Get so much more for what you pay for. So disappointed!

I go to this restaurant 1 or 2 times weekly and I love all dishes and desserts there. All people that work their are kind and polite. The environment outside is unique, many students from UCLA are shopping...talking...laughing...  I go there alone , but I feel I'm with a big group of happy people. I will share many picture of foods now. You can have some low calorie dishes too.

Stopped by last night around 830 for a late dinner so there wasn't a wait at all! We parked in the parking structure though because we didn't want to look around too long for the meter parking.  Ordered the chicken dumpling appetizers (I usually get the spinach artichoke dip- yum) and they were good but I had to wrestle with them a little bit because they fell apart easily. Next we ordered the Carnitas tacos (I know..came to CPK and didn't order pizza *gasp*). I love these tacos they're one of my favorites here! They come with chips and salsa on the side, and you can add avocados for an extra dollar too. The server was really nice and attentive so I enjoyed the whole experience.

The wait time during lunch is a bit much. Seems like there were empty tables but perhaps the kitchen was backed up so they had ppl wait. The food is like any normal CPK. They have a tasty assortment of pastas and pizza and salads plenty to choose from.  The only down side about this place is the wait. I work in the area and its certainly not a place to visit if you have an hour lunch time crunch. I suggest getting the food to go if  you are craving the CPK.  Overall just a typical CPK

Despite the recent menu changes from CPK, including changing the pepperoni pizzza (and making it worse), CPK has done some good recently. Their new bread and olive oil is fantastic. Their appetizers and small treats such as the chicken tinga quesadiila and the sesame ginger chicken dumplings are fantastic. sitting at the bar is nice and gives a great view of their flat screen tv. The bartenders and everyone that works there are also very nice and willing to accommodate any customer's needs. For the main course, try the cedar plank salmon! its delicious and comes with some spicy corn on the side that has some feta cheese sprinkled on top. its great!

Pizza! Pizza!  Cali Pie, That's they're signature, why mess with anything else?  The original BBQ chicken and Veggie on a thin crust is tasty.  The Thai & da works are also grubbin'.  If you're looking for a NY slice, you won't find it here, if that isn't already obvious.  Consistently good service across the franchise.  Good kids menu and a variety of menu offerings if you're not in the mood for a cali pie.
Good tasting topping, nice dough. I was at the head of the line for the takeaway, and the service was fast, but I was still begin many online orders, it seems. So, I will be going online next time.
Good food like always. Great variety and fast service. Pizza is amazing. You can't go wrong.

I came here for lunch today with two friends (12:30PM on a Tuesday) and we were seated quickly, and had relatively good service. I ordered the wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil, while my friends ordered the Club (avocado/bacon, lettuce) and another wild mushroom but w/o the truffle oil. The bread was good, the dipping oil for the bread was nice, and the pizza was "okay." I do feel like the restaurant was extremely overpriced for what I got. I want to reiterate that these are very thin, single serving pizzas that any grown person will finish in one sitting, so don't expect leftovers.  To be more specific, let's take the mushroom pizza I ordered today for example.  I honestly wouldn't call it any tastier than a mushroom pizza at say Papa John's, and that truffle oil is certainly overrated. The mushrooms are chopped pretty tiny-like so you don't really get the great texture that you could get when it's prepared whole, and a pizza that's basically just mushrooms, cheese, and bread is a little bit lacking in my opinion. I left paying $18 (including tip) for my wild mushroom pizza + truffle oil, and I would consider it an extremely large price for what I got. This is a good establishment, as it's clean, the flavors are nice, and the variety is good, but honestly I can't recommend it because of their high prices.

This review isn't based on the food or the service, which were decent, but on the fact that they allowed a customer to bring a dog inside.  The dog clearly was not a service dog, as the dog was tucked into the woman's purse, however after about ten minutes the lady brought the dog from her purse and put the dog on the booth sofa and the dog.  Other than being against the law, it just gross to have a dog on the booth and have his/her paws on the table. The bigger issue was no one said anything about it, not the waitress, not the manager, they just pretended that nothing was wrong.  Don't get me wrong, I love dogs, but if you want to bring your dog, then just go out and get a table in the patio and have the dog sit next to your chair.  The food wasn't that great and this experience ruined it, won't be coming back her again.
Bbq chicken pizza was really delicious. You should taste also Prosecco. For dessert, butter cake is a perfect choice ! There's a man named Will; you're the cutest associate ever !

Not what it used to be. This used to be one of my absolute favorites. CPK was always so incredibly good, I couldn't believe it was a chain. Now not only is the service always iffy (last five times in a row - literally last five times - got order wrong), but there's a weird bleachy smell on the tables and at the bar. Very unappetizing.

Not a huge fan of chain restaurants so I typically forget about CPK when deciding where to go for lunch, but every time I come here the food is consistently good. My favorite entree is the Moroccan-spiced chicken salad, which has a great combination of colors, textures, and tastes - chicken, butternut squash, beets, dates, toasted almonds, red peppers, and cranberries with a champagne vinaigrette dressing. Normally I don't like getting salads because I'm not that much into lettuce, but this is a very hearty salad with plenty of protein, and every mouthful feels like an adventure. The half portion is more than enough to fill me up. Had the spicy chicken tinga quesadilla the last time I was here, and while it wasn't spicy at all, it did taste good and felt much lighter than TLT fare (makes me shudder to think of what TLT's calorie count could be). The tortilla was perfectly crisp and the cheese was perfectly melted. Will have to remember to actually put CPK into my rotation every now and then.

I'm old enough to remember when this place was just the greatest - a really cool a chic place to go and have barbecue chicken pizza. I feel like it's caught in a time warm now, sort of like a middle-aged man who still dresses the way he did when he was 22 and happy. The food is just not as interesting anymore as it once was (the BBQ chicken salad is downright dull).

Wonderful experience, came here earlier tonight for my Dad's birthday and everything turned out amazing, the food, service, you name it! Only comment I would have to say is that I ordered a side of bacon with my pizza which turned out to be kind of salty but other than that everything was just simply amazing, would like to give a shout-out and thank our waitress who helped make the birthday dinner special: Clare, will be coming back for sure sometime in the near future!

I do not come here often, it is too mainstream for me. However, the last time I came I really enjoyed the selection of food my colleagues and I decided to share.  First, I highly recommend the BBQ Chicken Salad. It is soooo good and filling. You will not feel bad after eating this and the half size is perfect for lunch.  This particular visit, I shared this salad with three other women. It was perfect because we also shared a pizza. I was skeptical at first about our pizza choice but once I tried the Gorgonzola-Pear Pizza I was hooked! It was sooooo delicious. There's almost a salad right on top of it that you eat with the pizza. It's just perfect!  If you want to try an out of the ordinary kind of pizza, try this one for sure.  The service is pretty good, it feels like it fluctuates sometimes. I work down the street so I walk here, but there is free two hour parking in the lot across the street.

Came here for dinner since it was located directed across the street from the theater. We were seated quickly, we had a choice of inside dining or outside and we chose to sit outside since it was such a beautiful California night. We mentioned to the waiter that we only had about 45 minutes before our movie starts and he took our order and we received our food quickly. I had the carmelized peach salad with grilled salmon, it was everything! They brought out bread and oil but I skipped it, watching my figure lol. But my friends devoured it! If ever in that area, I would definitely come back to this location.

Had a Jamaican jerk pizza! The sauce is special, sweet and sour. The name is fun, hope it wont be offensive:) also have a bite of bbq chicken original. Its Shiva's bday so we are given a free dessert, made of brownie, taffy, ice cream and cream! My friends told me i could finish the whole, but i had half to go..
Hadn't been here in a while. It was very busy, and the servers weren't the greatest. However the food was great, I got the tostada pizza and it is was delicious. I just wish the service was better.

Always a go-to restaurant for me in Westwood when I don't know what to eat! It has great options for everyone. The pizzas are a good size to share, and pastas are excellent. I always go with the mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza. Standard safe and delicious option! For pasta, if I'm feeling like a heavy one, the cream ones are good. I usually go with the spaghettini with asparagus and spinach. I tried a pasta in the "Lite Adventures" list and got the shrimp scampi zucchini fettuccine last night and really liked it. It was a good mix of veggies and light sauce. It was just enough food! I am definitely getting this again.  I like CPK because it offers good vegetarian options. The pesto penne pasta is a go-to for me (don't forget to ask to add some veggies!) or the veggie pizza is also great. Minus one star for the sometimes slow service at this location, but it is usually packed since it is Westwood, and UCLA students are hungry college kids!

We were seated quickly, had a very good service as well. Their potato soup is absolutely delicious! We sat here on our laptops for couple of hours and they kept refilling our coffees (win) Definitely would go back.
The food is not exactly creative, but it's good, fast and reasonably priced if you just need to grab a bite at work.

If I could give zero stars, I would.  First, we walk in and there are about ten empty clean tables and the host takes us to the one dirty one. We have to stand there while he finds a rag and cleans it off. It's still dirty.  The waiter comes and tries to sell us some promotional thing. Before he even got us drinks.  They have remodeled, thought of some marketing schemes and all the while forgot to make good food. I would describe the food quality as "below average" and "corporate." It's amazing this place has survived so long, thanks to middle Americans and suburbanites who have to choice but to eat at chains like these.  If you're in the westwood area, do not eat here. Walk around the corner to Gushi and get a spectacular meal.
From the moment we walked in the door we felt welcome! The food was fresh and th service was impeccable.

This location is awesome! I had the best experience here! I went to dinner with a friend tonight and we decided to sit at the bar so we wouldn't have to wait for a table. The bartender was super nice and had some awesome suggestions for us. The manager was super sweet, I believe her name is Nicole! She checked on us multiple times. Our food took a while but we weren't really bothered by it but the manager was so nice that she gave us a complimentary dessert anyways! It was the butter cake with caramel topping and it was so awesome! For dinner we had the usual lettuce wraps and chipotle chicken pizza. Always hits the spot! I would definitely come to this CPK again! You cant beat great service!
The staff is so nice and welcoming. The food is great and the new renovation makes the place feel fresh and bright.

Best customer service & wait staff in Westwood.  Very good food!  The halibut was primo!  Big portion, enough for two meals.  Happy hour is a great deal.  Managers at this location are involved and appreciate their customers!  You will feel comfortable here even if you're dining alone.

Love the new look and menu! It's about time they changed things up a bit. There was a time in life when I absolutely loved CPK, but they basically faded into irrelevancy over the last few years. Now they've updated their look with a softer, farm-to-table feel and added some cool, upscale items to their already solid menu. We had their Valentine's special which was 1 app, 1 full salad, 1 pizza, and a dessert for $32! I calculated it saved at least $10, which I used to buy a craft cocktail made with avocado (the new "in" mixer apparently). Everything was delicious! Even their new bread and olive oil to start is good - fresh and warm! Spinach & artichoke dip can't help but make you feel good all over, though some of our group preferred having bread with it rather than the chips with which it's served. Our server happily brought plenty of extra bread. The Thai salad is hearty and flavorful. I think the pizza crust has been re-worked to be more Neapolitan, it seems to me. It was thin in the middle, puffy on the edges, and had nice structure with a little char. What can I say about the butter cake with ice cream - it's just the most sinful of indulgences. Enjoy the new CPK!

Great place for lunch. They also have outdoor seating. On Thursdays it is right next to the Farmers Market. You can eat and then go shopping all in one trip. Love the thin crust Margarita pizza and the roasted vegetables salad. Fast service.

This CPK location appears to be freshly remodeled with a contemporary California vibe. The layout is pretty open, but surprisingly not too noisy. I came in to have lunch with my mom while we were in the area, and it was an overall good experience. We shared a half Roasted Veggie Salad and Thin Crust Margherita Pizza. The salad had a good variety of roasted vegetables atop romaine and avocado. We ordered the vinaigrette on the side, which was perfect since the salad already had a lot of flavor. The pizza came out nice and crisp, just as thin crust should be.  All of the staff was friendly and quite helpful, they even held the door open when we entered AND when we left (I often find this only happens on the way in).

Generally nice staff. Fast service but they don't clear empty cups or plates very quickly. Asked for avocado on my salad per the waiter's suggestion but they didn't add it. I've had better cpk experiences but not terrible here.

Wow. This place has gotten no love from Yelpers. My experience is actually from the catering they did for us at work. My first CPK store was in St. Louis when I was a wee little kid (college), so I have fond memories. The four stars is really for the pasta dishes. It's weird. Their pastas are so much better than their pizzas! I would suggest trying their pastas for sure. The spaghetti bolognese and the asparagus and spinach spaghettini are awesome.  I do like the pizzas, although I agree it's slightly overpriced. I hear they have a happy hour! I'll definitely hop in and try their food in person some time.

I came in today and was greeted with great customer service and a welcoming atmosphere. They exhibited great interest in my thoughts about the food and gave me great suggestions on what I should get. My servers name was Daniel and would suggest him to anyone who is looking for a very attentive waiter. I thought that he could have been the manager the way that he carried himself. I will for sure be returning to get the original BBQ salad again.

New atmosphere. Looks so cool inside. Our hostess was super friendly. Our server, Carlos, was top notch too. Very professional like a 5 star restaurant. I am loving the changes at CPK. Great experience.

CPK is CPK. That is understood.  However, I had a weird experience here.  I went to the bathroom just before the meal got started.  As I was washing my hands, out from the locked toilet comes one of the CPK workers.  Instead of standing in line behind me to wash his hands, he went right back into the restaurant.  When I went back to my table, we joked and said our eews!  I then went over to him and said that I saw him walk out of the bathroom without washing his hands.  He told me that he washed them in the work area (double eew). I've seen in countless restaurants the sign that says that workers must wash their hands BEFORE leaving the restroom.  If there is a regulation requiring this, then CPK in Westwood is not following it.  I don't care if these servers are Hollywood types or not. They should obey the law just like everyone else. To the tall blond buy serving in CPK, wash your hands BEFORE you leave the restroom.  If you want to wash them again when you get to the work area, that's fine.  There is no substitute for washing them in the restroom... and you just came out of the sh*!ter.  Ouch! This guy wasn't our waiter, but the guy that was helping us was pretty cool.  That said, I'll still give them 3 stars.

I only ate half my pizza, and they boxed it for me. I get home to only a quarter of a pizza. Jerks! They also sat us in the back at a wobbly table and refused to move us because there weren't any more 2 people tables (there were 4 people tables left). Terrible...even though the pizza was tasty.

Good service and food at this location. They don't take reservations and the wait can be pretty long during peak hours but that's normal. I haven't been since they've remodeled it so I'm looking forward to checking it out.

I tried the sunny side up pizza with bacon. This pizza was delicious! The bolognese pasta was ok, it was a little bland but better than too salty. But I have to say the pizza was delicious and our server was great. Definitely recommend the sunny side pizza with bacon but not the pasta

I don't like to leave bad reviews but this place has bad service. The pizza I got was different and the meats were old. After waiting so long for someone to come to the table and order, I didn't feel like waiting more to replace the order. The chopped salad was not as good as other CP restaurants over all bad experience....
Our food was excellent as always but, the service today was superb and I thought why not post that! Thanks Eric and the staff for the "Cutest Couple Award Dessert...!!!" TWO THUMBS UP

Ok this is a real time review! My boyfriend and I went into another restaurant. Were seated but j just couldn't. I walked out and immediately saw California Pizza Kitchen! We were seated by a super sweet host and were greeted by an even sweeter server, Chelsea!! She's awesome!! Super super attentive and descriptive! Loved my sangria recommendation!! I'm totally getting the turkey sandwich lunch combo!! I'll update you when I get it!! ... Great Mowtown playlist today too!! ... Ok my sandwich: DELECTABLE! My boyfriends crispy chicken: AMAZING! The soup and salads we got were equally amazing! Great lunch date! Thanks Chelsea and thanks CPK!

Ordinary CPK, but very good location. Nice outdoor space made for people watching. I usually go for some of the salads, Cobb salad with dressing on the side, or the Thai salad. With that goes a bottle of San Pellegrino......

Much improved service and menu selections since there remodel of the restaurant. Atmosphere is very inviting with an open air and modern feeling and nice high tables. Food was very good and our server was quick and on top of everything. Even had a manger that was visible walking around making sure things ran smoothly, which they did. Overall experience was very, very good.

Ordered a gluten-free (+$2 extra) Pear and Gorgonzola pizza. Apparently the "salad" it came with was suppose to be put on top of the pizza. I only found out finishing the pizza and looking at the website menu. Yes, I ate the pizza topping as a salad. Oops.  The gluten-free crust here tastes great but it's leather-tough. Forget the knife. You'll build biceps sawing through this. For the guys, maybe you'll have that hot angular jawline after all the chewing. ;) I'm still very happy they offer gluten-free crust. Very much appreciated! Interesting flavors. The sweet caramelized pears and onions melded well with the hazelnuts and gorgonzola cheese. The hazelnuts seemed to have a slight stale taste.  Perhaps not enough people order this for them to go through the hazelnuts quickly enough. Nonetheless, I would get this again. Though this non-traditional pizza might be odd to some people. With 6 slices, this was definitely enough to share. Friendly service.

Our waiter was soo green.  Unbelievably fitting for a city filled with green actors looking to make their big break.  He was making an effort to which I commend him for, but he needs a ton of work and practice to know what exactly the restaurant he is working for offers and doesnt offer.  The food was consistent, which I would expect to find at any CPK.  Nothing memorable.

Came here during the lunch rush hour. Sat at the bar was served immediately! My salad came out as soon as the server brought over my drink.  That's service! Friendly, professional and attentive staff beginning with the front desk to management. Great experience.

Go to place when I wanna eat out buy not sure what I want. The pizza never dissapoints obviously. Gotta get the think crust BBQ. Always caught In between that and the chicken tequilla pasta. Most of the time get both or have my girl get and I get the other lol. N you know you gotta get the spinach dip. Its a must. Love this place. Glad it exists

I love coming to eat/DRINK here. And trust me, by the time you find a parking spot, you will be ready for a drink. Even if you are at this intersection for a different destination, it's a nice option to be able to pop in and have a brief adult beverage after battling the traffic.  And there is a lot to do nearby. I love all the little boutiques, and the theaters are just across the street. Parking as I said, can be a task. But I like the garage nearby with the first 2 hours free. And once you're here, pizza is the obvious favorite, but personally I love the salads and flatbread. I can't leave without enjoying a local beer or cocktail. As I write this review, strawberries are in season and the seasonal cocktail list has a number of tasty strawberry drinks. I like the strawberry mojito.  Lastly, I really like the friendly staff here. Jewels, Ryan, and Garret will completely take care of you. I've never had less than awesome service here.

The pizza is good, our waiter was nice... but $1.50 to add spinach to a pizza, really? Not giving a complimentary birthday dessert even though we had a group of 8+ people, giving THEM business and choosing to come to them to celebrate a birthday?  In their defense, they did give it us ice cream after I sighed and rolled my eyes at them, but the fact that our waiter had to 'beg' his manager to give us a free ice cream (in his words) is kinda pathetic. This restaurant isn't THAT good or upscale to merit that kind of pretentiousness. So yeah... I'm not a fan of places that just try to get all the money they can from you... but our server was nice enough and the food was good. I'm just no longer supporting this chain!
This place is ok. Nothing too exciting and a good place to hang out for a meal with friends in Westwood. Had the pasta with spinach, asparagus and cheese. The service is attentive and good.

My boyfriend commented how impressed he was with this location and how nice it was. We met his Uncle for lunch and had our pup with us .. We didn't have a wait for our table in the outdoor patio seating. Got the thin crust Sicilian pizza .. Not too spicy and was a decent size to be shared 6 slices. I got a petite wedge salad.. Which was tasty but drenched in dressing .. So for the future will make sure to get it on the side next time.  Our waiter was friendly and attentive with refills , albeit a little slow with some check ins and getting the check .. But not a big deal. All in all was a good experience.

Newly renovated. Awesome decor. A definite big plus walking in but I wish I could say the same about the food. Shrimp scampi pasta barely had any noodles but only slices of zucchini. Also way too much butter. The Sicilian thin crust pizza was so dry I had to dip it IN the buttery pasta sauce just to eat it. Fairly disappointed and probably won't ever come back again
I love Cpk! Easy place to go get food and chill. Me and my mom were at Rodeo, and wanted some food, so we came here and it was amazing.

I've been on hold with CPK for the past 10 minutes only to have them hang up on me, repeat the same information over and over again and are unable to deliver due to me being barely out of their mile radius. Horrible service.

I work closeby so I stopped by for lunch on a weekday with a coworker.  They've done a nice job renovating the inside of the restaurant.  It looks bigger and more open.  They have a nice lunch menu; options such as pizza, soup or salad.  I had their mushroom and spinach pizza with tortilla soup.  The pizza was pretty tasty; good size for lunch portion.  Soup was a nice size as well.  Overall, it was a pleasant visit. Staff and service was friendly and checked in on us regularly.

Slowest take out service ever. Placed the order online at 4:30 pm for a 4:45 pm pick up. Arrived at 5:00 pm, order not ready. Still waiting.... Unprofessional staff, slow service, zero stars if possible.
A very good spicy Sicilian thin crust pizza with two fried eggs.  The Sicilians would turn over in their graves but actually, it tasted great.

Came here tonight was our first time and also our daughters first birthday. We had a great meal our server was nice but the manager Kelly was awesome. She not only chatted with us several times but also bought our daughters birthday sundae. Now that may not seem like a big deal to most, but to me it was. She was so friendly and sweet and I really appreciate her doing that. When we are back in the area we will definitely be back!

I absolutely love CPK. Ever since I was a child, it was always my go to. The menu has completely changed in the past few years but there are some of my favorites that are still on there.  The split pea soup at CPK is my favorite soup from any restaurant.  The tricolor salad pizza is not on the menu anymore but you can still order it and it's delicious. It's a delicious light salad on top of thin, sweet, crispy bread.  I also love that they've redecorated all the restaurants. It has a great feel.

I had a great time at this restaurant- food was excellent (the garlic chicken and vegetables is the best) and staff were super friendly. I will definitely be back. A side note- I left my card at the restaurant and was incredibly relieved to find out they had it and got it back to me safely.

Friendly service, nice atmosphere (especially inside), and great menu. I recommend the spicy chipotle chicken pizza because it is flavorful but only mildly spicy. I also like the italian chopped cobb salad and the dijon dressing is amazing.
Ordered the Five Cheese Pizza. Was not good at all. Too oily. Also ordered the Artichoke dip which could have been better. Would not come here again.

This is a cozy little corner restaurant in the heart of Westwood. I've never been a huge CPK fan but I realized I never get what they are known for...which is pizza. So this trip I decided to dig into some pie. I was deciding between the Sicilian and the Pear+Gorgonzola but ultimately went with the Sicilian, because, who doesn't want meat on their pizza. This dough is piled with the perfect amount of meat and veggies. The Italian sausage was the best part. Perfect little pieces of a spicy and juicy sausage.  With great food and great service, I have nothing to complain about after my meal. Will definitely be coming back when I'm in the mood for some good pizza.

Usually love this location and restaurant. I placed an online catering order here and paid online and received no confirmation. I then called multiple times to check the status of my order and no one had any information.  Just be advised that you must place catering/to-go orders over the phone!

I downloaded the Yelp app right this second as I'm sitting in the restaurant just so I can leave this review. I've been coming here for years and I can say now that I will NEVER come here again. Two of the staff were extremely rude, one of which seemed to be the manger.  If you want more than six pieces of pasta when you order a pasta, then don't eat here. And if you don't want to get a disgusting, bad attitude from the staff for bringing it to their attention, then don't eat here.

Just careless and rushed service. Most recently, I was asked if I was ready to order as soon as I sat down and then again a minute later, we didn't have the right utensils at the start of the meal, and the check was dropped before I'd eaten a third of my entree. I also really can't stand their flatware pattern. It's so modern as to be impractical for actually piercing food. If they want to turn over tables, they should get forks that don't slow everyone down from actually eating.  And it's all too bad, really, because their food is good!

Its safe to say that my recent experience at CPK was not a great one. I came during prime dinner time, but the wait was not too bad considering how small my party was. My 2 friends and I decided to do family style and got two pizzas and a pasta. We got the Hawaiian, Thai chicken pizza and chicken Alfredo pasta. The dishes came out in a reasonable manner. The food tasted okay, I've had better. As we were eating our Thai pizza, we notice a bug crawling in our Thai pizza. We alerted our server who apologetically took the pizza away. A few minutes later, the manager came and told us they could not find the bug but will make us a new pizza anyways. I was not satisfied with how the management handled the situation and will surely not be coming back anytime soon.

I went here and sat inside once with a friend. The service was very good. The server continually came to ensure that we were alright, and made sure our cups were always full. I always get the Garlic Fettuccine and it always is fantastic. Since the one visit, I have gone back and ordered my Fettuccine take out. Overall, the takeout service is great. I have never had to wait longer than 10 minutes because I normally order my food before I arrive. Overall, great place with good food. Great to go to have lunch or dinner with a friend.

Recently remodeled location offering everything you expect from a member of this chain. The new interior opens up the space and adds more seating, though many people still opt to sit outside. Service was good, pasta was good! The noise level is pretty high though, as the division between the regular dining area and the bar is virtually non-existent. If you're coming here for a quiet dinner and some conversation, aim to skip game days.

Foodbat CPK is delicious. I like the location, it's on a busy pedestrian corner in Westwood, sit outside, it's great for people-watching.  You can't go wrong with the pizzas here. The issue is that every time I go to CPK, one pizza is not enough for 2 people, 2 pizzas is too much. I suggest splitting a delicious appetizer such as spinach artichoke dip or the rolls. Then get a pizza, the Mexican pizza is pretty interesting, but they're all tasty options. Also, they have a decent selection of desserts.  The one thing I dislike about CPK is the prices. I always feel like I spent 15-20 dollars more than it was worth. If you can hold on until later in the night, happy hour deals on drinks can help!

Awesome new bar at California  Pizza Kitchen with the freshest ingredients I've ever seen. Pizza ((Roasted artichoke  and spinach stop chicken) was honestly amazing. The two bartenders (Dan and Ryan) were the nicest, friendliest guys I've seen bartend in ages. So nice to one another, the staff and customers.    Go there,  enjoy, you won't be sorry!
Just watched a waitress carry a diaper across the restaurant dinning area very non-discreetly... very unappetizing.
It's the best restaurant in its price range and their staff are super welcoming and caring .

My sister and I stopped in here to grab a quick lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We were seated right away as it was not busy at all. It was your basic CPK experience- good but nothing amazing. We split the roasted garlic and chicken pizza which was good. We had at least three different people serve us so we were a little confused on who to ask when we needed something but we were served nonetheless. Overall the pizza was good and we will most likely be back.

The food was alright, not great. I went there last week. The most redeeming thing was my waitress. She was super upbeat and saw that I was having a bad day and made me smile. Her name was Katie but I kept calling her Kate. Hope she will be my waitress again if I go back.

After spending many hours at UCLA, my friend and I thought we would go grab a bite to eat.  You bet our eyes caught the word pizza! CPK is definitely a familiar restaurant to both of us so we thought hey why not!  Since we had a few snacks on campus, we weren't too hungry. So, we decided to substitute our pizza craving and go for some small plates/appetizers. But first of course, we asked for the delicious complimentary bread.  The bread brought to us as the perfect golden, toasty, warm, and fresh out of the oven with a side of oil.   I ordered the spicy chicken quesadilla which comes with a side of spicy mayo under small plates and it was delicious! My friend ordered the shrimp lettuce wraps which was a great appetizer! We were both content with the meals we got.  At the end of our dining, our check took unusually long for our waiter to bring to us especially for being 3 pm in the afternoon and not very busy. Overall, another great experience at CPK.

I visited this location in late august.  After waiting for an hour and a half for a salad, I accidentally left my expensive pair of Ray Bans on the table after paying.  I called the restaurant the next day and they told me that nothing was found, but that they would ask the staff. After calling multiple times over the next week, one of the employees told me that the restaurant has a homeless problem and that homeless people often wander into the restaurant and steal things off the tables.  This seemed to be an odd business choice, especially since they have 3 greeters at the door.  So, I didn't buy that story. When I asked to see any security footage, the claimed that there were no cameras. I reached out to the corporate office multiple times and I've yet to hear back from them - even though its been almost two months. This has to be the worst costumer service I've ever experienced. I will never visit this restaurant again.

From all the various cpk restaurants I've been to, this place is sort of my favorite. Been a regular customer coz I've been taking my dinner breaks at this place at least millions of times. I wanted to rate this restaurant for a long time but I've been busy;(.  originally, I was going to rate this restaurant a five star for Nicole (store manager) and Chris (bartender) but unfortunately Nicole left;(. They should hire someone like her. The other managers approach you with an awkward feeling. Compare to Nicole she has that had a friendly and welcoming aura. Too bad she left.  The food---it's a hit or miss kinda thing. Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's crappy. Depends on the chef or days you go.  Customer service---When you dine in the table setting sometimes waiters or waitresses are rude or some are nice. Some cares if you're on break but it's always a slow service. If you sit at the bar Chris is really good with his service.
I love this place for location and menu!  Always have their lunch menu which includes soup and half-sandwich. My fav soup is "farmers market" delicious, the tastiest ever!!!

This place is very bad at first I thought that the manager was nice but then she accused my wife of not putting her name on list then she asked did you seat yourself we said no a man sat us down I would totally never come here Again they do not appreciate there customers and then after that she talked to our waiter and told him bad stuff about us when we didn't do anything if I could I would rate it 0 stars but I can't so do not come here

Take out order was promised in 10 minutes, available in 45.  Extremely rude service.  When I arrived after 15 minutes, the takeout guy said it was still in the oven, then I heard nothing.  After 35 minutes, I asked the 3 waitresses at reception how long a take out order should take.  They all said 10 minutes, so I asked where my order was.  One looked and found that it had been in a warming oven.  Of course in the 10 minutes it took me to get home, it was stone cold.   As I left I called out to the guy that they should be honest with customers.  He said I was being rude.  I said it was rude of them to take 45 minutes for something they promised in 10 minutes.  He shouted that the time was nowhere close to this.  According to my watch, it was 45 minutes.  How do these people stay in business gratuitously insulting customers?

Despite its name, I don't come to CPK for their pizza. It's their pasta that keeps me coming back. I always opt for the angel hair with asparagus and spinach. It's sooo good! A simple dish with lots of flavor and pretty healthy to boot. I love how they always put a ton of garlic on top. And, I get it without the cheese. Not a fan of cheese on pasta, but chili flakes are a hell-yeah! The spaghetti bolognese is also a good dish! This one is for the meat lovers.  As far as the pizza goes, I would pass considering there are two pizza joints in the same area that serve way better pizza.

I've never been to CPK until one night a week ago when in Westwood Village. The place is beautiful and lively; it really drew me over. My friend, her boyfriend, and myself decided to eat there and it was a great decision. We got several salads (peanut dressing is spectacular) and fresh chips and guacamole and drinks then chocolate soufflé topped with Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream. The waiters were very nice and the service was great. The prices are true to the food, and parking can be found on the blocks all around for free after 8PM or in a public parking lot across the street that is two hours free. The area is wonderful because it has everything - from pastries to dinners to breakfast and cafes and CVS and all types of foods and clothing stores, honestly name it, it's there! CPK has an outdoor seating area with heaters and the indoor is dim lit and cool. Great place for a date or just a night out with friends. Ambiance and service and food is exquisite. Would definitely return and encourage others to give it a go as well!
Will D was our server.. He was attentive, efficient, personal and very friendly.... The pizza and salad was above average/very good. I would definitely come back here again!

simply love this place. everyone i come in they get my order right and never really like mistakes.  They have added a lot of space with their renovation and it has worked out wonderfully so far.  the lunch specials is mainly what I get and can't complain a bit.

CPK is a chain, and with all good chains, I like to rate primarily on the service because the food is pretty standard. If you have never been to CPK, it's a California pizza joint. What do I mean by California pizza? California cuisine has been characterized by fresh, healthy, local ingredients and beautifully designed dishes. CPK stays true to the cuisine by delivering that in its dishes. Service at this CPK is pretty great. Very attentive and came by often. Only issue was my water cup did not get equal amount of attention- boo. Otherwise, I love the option of sitting outdoors or indoors. Great place to have a work meeting- just the occasion I came here for. During lunch, they have lunch specials which are some of CPK's selected pizzas or sandwiches in smaller portions with a salad. Great way to eat pizza without feeling too full.  I ordered the lunch special (note: you cannot try substituting any of their other pizzas, I tried and failed) with the classic BBQ chicken pizza and a caesar salad. Definitely was still pretty filling, even though the pizza was smaller than normal. You could probably take two slices home still if you hold yourself from overeating.
Service and flavor is really really good. Glass smell like egg. I think they didnt wash the glass well.

Westwood just isn't as bubbly as it once was. We hadn't been here for a while and wanted to have dinner at a couple places we used to frequent:  they are gone! So CPK it is.  We sat at the pizza bar as we did not want to have to wait 30 mins for a table. Seems like everyone is coming here: young, old, funny looking... All tables are taken.  Ruby came and took our drink orders and our food orders. She brought us bread and olive oil dip to share while we wait for our food.  We sit right where the pizza chefs create their pizzas. Watching them work is a treat! This is where we will sit from now on! Pizza - the works:  3.5 stars. Not as flavorful as expected.  Bolognese spaghetti - 3.5 stars. Sauce is flavorful, but they didn't put enough of it on the noodles so the dish is dry.  Garlic cream fettuccine - nothing spectacular, but it isn't bad.  Kung pao spaghetti -  like! Not a greasy or salty as I remembered.  Quinoa arugula salad - five stars. I seriously am going to go home and try to make this. So good.  Typical CPK quality food. The service here is exceptional. I would come back again for the quinoa salad and the service!

Called three times confirming our large group and they said they could accommodate. We show up and they have zero availability for us. Manager also gave attitude. Our bill would have been enormous. I hope their corporate office reads these.
I love CPK.  The are great with their service and work hard to make you what you like.  It is a fun place to go alone or with a group. If you need some where fun to dine---check them out.
on   for work lunch - terrible. absolutely 100% cold, as was my coworker's. His also had only one of the toppings he'd ordered. bleh, how disappointing

I came in for lunch and sat at the bar. The bar tender was named Dan, he made a great drink suggestion and I really enjoyed the way he made it! If you're in the mood for good service and a great drink come get a California crush from Dan- he's the man!  I got my usual meal and the food didn't disappoint at this CPK!

I had not been to a CPK in a long time; primarily because I didn't think there was one nearby. Came here for lunch with a small group. I had the personal veggie pizza and Mediterranean salad lunch special. It was very good. Everyone liked what they had.

So I come to CPK not infrequently.  Love the pizza but often feel guilty because it is so good I devour it.  Tonight I made a healthier and amazing choice.  Halibut over butternut with asparagus on Farro!   Wow!  It was incredibly good.   One of my recent favorites.  My wife had Kung pao spaghetti and said it too was excellent!   Wonderful service and right down the street from my Bruins and DD Reese cookies!  I resisted that temptation tonight but highly recommend this yummy cookies too!!

Excellent customer service and food. We decided to sit at the bar and the bar tender loved his job! He was friendly and helped make good menu choices for us which was all good. Really nice full bar with the ability to make fresh cocktails. Thank you !

I was in the Westwood area at UCLA for my dad, so I decided to treat my parents out to lunch and we stopped here. When we arrived, it wasn't too busy, and not too empty either, we were greeted by two hosts, who took us to our seats without any issues or wait time. When we approached our seating booth, the table and the seats were dirty, seemed like they clean up after the last table and just immediately wanted to seat the next group, so we asked the hostess if they could clean it before we sat, she simply took her hand and brushed everything away as if it was never there (How unsanitary). Anyway, our server was Jake. Super nice! I ordered the Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler, so delicious! The bar had to make our drinks, so we were given waters in the meantime. Since we came around lunchtime, the lunch menu combo was the best choice for us. I ordered the Original BBQ Sandwich (Full), with a side of Caesar salad. The sandwich was delicious! Everything we ordered was well cooked, tasteful, and fresh.  Overall a good experience. I would have expected the bill to be more expensive because of location wise, but it was well worth the service we were given!

No curb side pick up at this location. Parking is bad in that area. So i called ahead and asked if they had curb side pick up and was told YES before placing my order. When i arrived i could not find a sign saying curb side pickup so i called and they told me that they do not  have it at this location. food was good.

If you don't mind waiting 30 minutes for two pastas that are subpar in almost every dimension, then this place is the place for you! Corner Bakery, literally around the corner, is a better deal. Also, thanks for jokingly accusing me of wanting to make sure you guys didn't overcharge/lie about the transaction... I just literally wanted to pay and leave as soon as possible. Not coming back. Also, your strawberry mango coolers are terrible. How much sugar do you have to add to a drink to cover up for the lack of flavor? (Answer: as much to give an elephant diabetes)
Terrible food and overpriced heavily. Service was good but the food was dry and tasteless

I'm a huge fan of CPK, and my boyfriend is a server at a CPK an hour away from this one so I eat the food often. I went to this location for the first time on Thursday since I was down at UCLA for school related stuff. It wasn't too busy on a Thursday night, so we got seated right away. I believe our servers name was Emma (shorter blonde girl). She was super nice and a great server!!!  My food was amazing (I had the spinach artichoke dip and a pepperoni pizza with basil). I love the fresh ingredients that CPK uses. Besides the food, this post is really about Emma, and how great of a server she was!  I definitely recommend requesting her, I know I will next time I'm at this location!

I haven't been in a Ca Pizza Kitchen for a few years. This place is nice and the menu is ok, the service is fine. My only complaint would be the order I had. I had the jambalaya and although the flavor was good, they left the tails on the shrimp, tossed the dish with healthy abandon. So I am picking shrimp tails out of my dish. For the price I would prefer not to have to do that. I would return but not order that meal again.

The service here is kind of spotty. The waiter was kind of weird. I think he kept avoiding us because we were talking about Game of Thrones and he was an episode behind. If CPK can make sure that all their waiters are caught up on all my favorite HBO series so I can talk about them freely with my friends and also get regular refills on my water, that would be great, thanks. I don't like to compromise. Oh and their food is expensively mediocre (mediocrely expensive? I give up man. Just let me watch Game of Thrones).

Booked a table for 15, restaurant called to confirm on the date. We arrived and there was no table. Management asked us to wait 15-20 min, no concessions offered. After 45 minutes, management says that they "actually" do not take reservations, so they can't really take any blame... instead of apologizing. We left.

It's a chain so my I'm adjusting my expectations.  Positives: They accommodate large parties well. Good for banquets (15-20 people).  Hostesses and waitress were nice. The waitress even split our bill 15 ways-wow! Chicken tequila fettuccine is my favorite thing. Nice and cheesy with a twist of lime. Yes.  Decent prices.  Criticisms: Parking is tough.  Bus boys were not as friendly as the other staff. Nothing special, just what I would expect from a CPK.

I totally pigged out on a Friday night here before going to see a movie in the area. The service was great, and the food has never disappointed.
